intro: Cochranea taltalensis, commonly known as the Taltal cochrania, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of northern Chile. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring season. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
